revision.comment: [[c:Help:Cat-a-lot|Cat-a-lot]]: Copying from [[Category:American male comedians]] to [[Category:American comedians]]
revision.text:
'''Brian Daniel Miner''' (born March 27, 1981) is an American [[comedian]] and [[satire|satirist]]. He is known for his co-creation of the live sketch comedy series ''The Crippling Thoughts of Victor Bonesteel'' along with fellow writer and comedian Bryan Finnigan [https://archive.is/20130105010057/http://media.www.theorion.com/media/storage/paper889/news/2005/05/11/Entertainment/Sketch.Comedy.Spoofs.Life-1508061.shtml] [http://www.newsreview.com/chico/Content?oid=34848].
==Presidential Campaign== In July 2007, Miner launched a satirical campaign for [[President of the United States]] as a means of drawing attention to the [[United States Presidential Election, 2008|2008 election]] and encouraging people to [[Voting|vote]] [https://web.archive.org/web/20110208002302/http://brianminer2008.com/]. In his campaign, Miner plays the role of a naive and dangerously underqualified candidate.
==References== 1. [https://archive.is/20130105010057/http://media.www.theorion.com/media/storage/paper889/news/2005/05/11/Entertainment/Sketch.Comedy.Spoofs.Life-1508061.shtml http://www.theorion.com]
2. [http://www.newsreview.com/chico/Content?oid=34848 http://www.newsreview.com]
3. [http://www.myspace.com/brianminer2008 http://www.brianminer2008.com]
==External links== *https://web.archive.org/web/20110208002302/http://brianminer2008.com/
